review_title: Best absolute bang for the buck in the studio monitor ...
review_body: Best absolute bang for the buck in the studio monitor / affordable audiophile arena.  You won't find a better headphone for the two or three times the bucks.  Large soundstage, open airiness. and accurate sound reproduction.If you want headphones that color your music (heavy bass) look elsewhere....  these headphones reproduce exactly what was recorded... nothing more, nothing less.if you want your music the way that the artist / producer intended it to be heard... with every subtle nuance.  Do not hesitate.  Grab 'em and smile.  You've just saved yourself a HUGE amount of hassle of trying to find accurate headphones and a LOT of $$$$$$ while doing it.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: easily the best pair of headphones I've ever used
review_body: I owned a pair of these for about 2 years, and for the price, easily the best pair of headphones I've ever used. And they're indestructible; I mean, I've taken these things through hell and back. I almost never use a case with them when traveling with them (I usually have them on), and throw them in my backpack as I would one of my books. They probably get dropped on the ground daily, with no scratches, broken parts, or sound issues. They still sound as good as Day 1. These things have amazingly "pure" sound, as they're not too bass heavy like most headphones around this price level - they're studio headphones. They sound just fine without any sort of amp; it sounds fine plugged straight into your phone or laptop. After owning a pair of these, you'll notice tons of musicians  and produces from amateurs to professionals frequently wield these, and it's easy to see (or hear) why: these things are just awesome.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Love them, worth so much more
review_body: Absolutely amazing sound.  Blows anything out of the water of gaming headsets.  I have a 250$ wireless headset and I will never use it again after these.  Who cares if I end up with wires and a separate mic.  BTW I paired these woth the dirt cheap Zaman zm-mic1.  There is some background do but who cares for sound like this.  Spend 50 on mic if you care about what your friends hear and get a snowball or whatever.  I love these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: What amazing headphones for on-set audio monitoring
review_body: What amazing headphones for on-set audio monitoring. These headphones clip the lower and higher frequency as we typically will do for voiceover EQ in post production. This allows us to know on-set that we are getting the audio we are looking for. BUT because of this amazing on-set usage these headphones are not good for listening to music or for mixing unless you actually adjust the internal EQ through expensive hacking software or add an eq to your computer output (http://www.thestringnetwork.com/viewtopic.php?t=5632).
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: They feel great! They are very comfortable and do a great job of cancelling out noise. Clear and crisp sounds.Update: 1-8-18.  These headphones are great. My grandson has been using these while he plays his games. Told him to be careful with them but you know kids(9yrs old). This headphones still keep their shape and comfort even with the 'abuse' they are going through. Great buy!!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I'm not an audiophile, and I really don't need this headphones ... but I wanted to splurge on something high quality for my ears. These headphones are amazing. I use them while gaming, and I can pretty much hear everything. I love the bass these headphones give off. Additionally, they come in a neat, padded box. I'm very careful with these, however, because I don't want the cord to pull out and stop working. I bought these headphones 2 years ago, and so far so good. The cups for the ears are very comfortable (although, like any headphone, they can get hot after a while). The only con I see is the way the adjustable area will slide up and down on its own, because it slides so smoothly. I would buy these again though.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I've had a 7506 for many years, and the sound reproduction is fantastic.  Mine finally literally came unglued (not sure replacement headphone pads will suffice) after well over 10 years of use, so I need to get a new pair.  I was a bit surprised that the price is still the same after all these years, but then, they're great headphones--and if the research I've done on the 7509 is accurate, the 7509 isn't necessarily a step up and costs 3 times as much.  The frequency response of the 7506 is 10Hz to 20kHz, whereas that of the 7509 is 5Hz to 80kHz.  My first thought was even if the human ear could discern that high of a kHz.  After doing some research about that, I found that the human ear (unless I'm mistaken) cannot discern anything CLOSE to 80kHz--the highest value I found was about 20kHz.  I also saw that other users on here were talking about a hollow or "wooden" midrange sound on the 7509.So once I'm done with this review I'm going to buy a new 7506 to replace my overused one.  The coating on the earpieces does flake off a bit after a pretty short time, but mine never flaked off entirely or even close to entirely, and the phones are very comfortable.  Definitely recommend the 7506.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: These are an industry standard in radio. Very durable with an exception. The weak part of these is the ear pads and expect them to fail pretty quick. Good news is that you can buy replacement's that are much better than the ones that come on these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Love them! I got these as a recommendation from a friend. I was looking for just an all around great pair of headphones that I could bring with me anywhere. These head phones are great for pretty much everything. My only thing I have with them, is that the chord is reeeeaaaalllllyyyyy long... so prepare for that. Other than that, they sound great and I recommend you get em.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: so obviously I thought these sounded amazing for its crisp highs
review_body: Can't really comment on the sound since I upgraded from $30 headphones to these, so obviously I thought these sounded amazing for its crisp highs.But I can say that these are very comfortable, I can have these on all day without discomfort. The coiled cord didn't, even after going on countless walks with these headphones and stuffing them into my backpack before school for a year. Also, I've had no problems with the jack.The small carrying bag these came with is a nice convenience.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: The bass is not over powered but it's definition is amazing. The M50X's bass seems to be amplified a ...
review_body: These sound incredible.  I also own a pair of the Audio-Technics M50X headphones.  For me, these Sony cans sound more clear and they stay clear at loud volumes.  The bass is not over powered but it's definition is amazing.  The M50X's bass seems to be amplified a little.  The M50X design feels better around the ears but these sound better.  I would purchase another pair of these first.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Some of my favorite headphones. They have a nice flat frequency response and are very sensitive. They reveal the smallest details in the music and are very light weight and adjustable. The cord and phone connector is very sturdy and nice too. A bargain at the price!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: If you're looking for professional headphones on Amazon because your crappy consumer headphones broke and you need something better, I'm guessing you're a lot like me. You're not in a sound booth at a concert nor are you manning the sound board on Broadway. You're a videographer and you edit your own videos, you work with voiceover for small commercial work, or you mix music on the side. If you fall under these, stop looking for headphones. Just buy these already.Here is what I like. With the way Sony packaged these headphones, I felt as if I had bought a crown jewel. I was very impressed by the the packaging. I expected them to arrive in a cardboard box and protected by a plastic bag. They came in a nice-ass sleeve and pillowed by a friggin' nice piece of fabric. As consumers, too often what we buy is abused before we even get our dirty hands on it. These, too sound cliche, seemed to have been handled with care by Mr. Sony himself.  Plus it comes with a nice little nylon or leather case...that I'll probably never use. But still.So the headphones themselves. Amazing. They feel professional. Heavy duty. I was choosing between these and a Sennheiser model. I'm glad I chose these. Several days later, I noticed one of my fellow videographers had the Sennheiser and I immediately noticed how flimsy and light they felt. The top part was all plastic. These have weight to them.  They do not weigh your head down; they just feel as if they could take a beating.A con...if you could call it that. You're not going to be traveling easily with these. They aren't compact. But if you're looking for something mobile and compact...then why are you looking at monitor/editing headphones? These will sit and stay at my computer.So, buy these. I am not one to praise products. Seems everything is crap nowadays. These are not. This, I think, is the only review I've ever left for a product because I am so impressed with them.Lastly, do put in a good day of using the headphones. It takes a little use to begin hearing the bass as well as you might want to. I read somewhere...or maybe heard on cnet that these tend to be more treble oriented.  I do not find this to be the case. Great overall range.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Great sound, with very extended high end and bass.  The cup seals are perfect, too.  Took me a while to get around the product wanting to fold its cups whenever I picked it up, but I finally found the trick: just hold it band up, spread the cups, shake, and the cups will unfold for use.  A lot of headphone for the price, and I'd definitely buy them again if something happened to these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: I Spend Way Too Much Time Listening To Music Now!
review_body: I have been listening to Cheap $5-20 ear buds and Panasonic lightweight headphones my entire life.  I purchased a pair of Skull Candy, over the ear headphones last year and really appreciated the step up in performance over what I had been using previously.  Unfortunately the Skull Candy headphones snapped in half over my big melon in a little less than a year of light to moderate use.I decided to step it up and purchase a set of these and think it was the best hundred bucks I have ever spent.  If you love sitting and listening to music for hours at a time then you owe it to yourself to pick up a pair of these sweet things.They sounded great right out of the box.  After about 2 months of listening to them nearly every day for multiple hours they sound even better.I should note that I was almost scared away by a few highly rated reviews on Amazon.  One stated the comfort was inferior.  I couldn't disagree more.  I have a huge head (6' 4" 260lbs) and they fit me great!  I enjoy 2-3 hour sessions 4-5 days a week now.  A few others mentioned something about these headphones having a, "neutral" sound to them.  They went on to suggest people who were looking for an improved sound should look elsewhere.  I'm not sure what a neutral sound is, but these are anything but neutral sounding for me.  I hear all the instruments much more vividly now.  Everything is much more clear, including voices.  The best way I can describe it is that it sounds like I'm in the studio listening to the band record.I can't believe I waited so long to grow, er..., get, a pair.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Jesus, I've had these since 2014, they still work great, I've mixed so much music. It's been four years of abuse, how are these things still together!? These headphones are a great decision. The sound will not blow your mind as It's a studio monitor with a flat response, so it sounds like a really accurate stock iPhone headphones. Like it sounds very generic and bland but in the best way cause that helps you mix music very well. These are great for professional work, they are a reliable tool!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: The Gold Standard in the Broadcasting Industry For a Reason
review_body: As a former television production professional, I can attest that these are indeed the pro standard in the broadcasting industry. They've been around for nearly 25 years, and have proven themselves in harsh production environments. There is a good reason Sony keeps making these headphones after all these years. They are quite simply the best headphones on the market for under $100. Bass is deep and tight while highs are crisp and clear. The frequency response Sony claims is accurate, and they are quite sensitive. They don't need much power to produce great sound.Sony also deserves credit for including a nice pouch and supplying a gold-plated 1/4" adapter. The packaging is great too. You can't go wrong with the Sony MDR-7506 Headphones. At this price point, nothing on the market can compete with these cans for audio and video production. Very few items have a 25-year production run, so the longevity of these headphones should tell you all you need to know. Sony has yet to have a reason to replace these. They are just that good.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Purchased for my husband. I will tell you that these are so much cheaper than Beats and just as good. I tried on Beats at the store the other day and gotta say they are awesome but NOT $250 awesome. These I purchased for my husband as he records with Pro-Tools and has his iPod every where he goes. So these will last him quite a while. They came highly recommended from a Pastor friend who leads the Praise and Worship team as he stated all recording artists he knows uses them. So I do highly recommend them if you are looking to record in a studio or at home. The company sent them quickly and they were packaged great. Really happy with the purchase. If you find them for cheaper somewhere else be ware. They may not be new. Don't risk it and just buy these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: The sound was good and they were reasonably comfortable
review_body: The sound was good and they were reasonably comfortable, but they get 2 stars off for quality: less than a year after light/occasional use by a responsible, careful adult, the cord connection at the headphones has broken irreparably. Not sure if this is a defect in my particular pair, but I'd have expected this sort of thing only after years of heavy use or improper handling. 90 day product warranty is useless.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I previously used Koss Pro 4AA and loved how smooth and wide the frequency response was. They finally died and went for these Sony headphones after reading all the reviews. My son-in-law uses an expensive, noise cancelling Bose set and the Sony's compare very favorably to them. In fact, I only found that the  Bose has a slightly lower deep end which I think is slightly exaggerated. These headphones are a great replacement for my beloved Koss phones! I highly recommend these headphones to anyone looking for a pair that will reproduce the sound the way the audio engineers/mixers wanted it to sound like!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Durability, Quality, Value - the best money you can spend on headphones.
review_body: I purchased these in March of 2011 for a couple of dollars more than they are selling now. That's point number one in their favor: even though Sony has a clear winner here, they are not jacking up the price - for under $100 these things are a genuine bargain.Second point in their favor: durability. I am not fancy about my equipment. This is not a pro studio, it's my office, and I have way too much stuff crammed everywhere. These headphones have been dropped, misplaced, spilled on, and generally abused from day 1. They still function perfectly with zero difference between now and when they were brand new. Even the rubber "leather-esque' phone covering around the earpieces is holding up ... let's just say I haven't had the same luck with other headsets.But most important is the sound, right? Right. And these sound ... correct. A lot of people who I show these to are not impressed because they want the sound to be shaped to modern standards. That's not the purpose here, and it's not what you want with studio 'phones. These sound true, and that's not 'sexy' but these aren't sexy phones, they are workhorses.5 stars, no question.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I just received my MDR-7506 headphones from Amazon and couldn't be more pleased. Shipping was prompt and they arrived in perfect condition. These are quite frankly the best sounding headphones I've ever owned! I can hear subtleties in my music that I never knew were there. The sound range from lows to brilliant highs is very pleasing to my taste. I can't wait to rediscover my entire collection.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I absolutely love these headphones. Before I bought these, I was using my favorite pair of earbuds (also Sony) at my job. The length of the earbuds was too short, and I ended up always having to remove them to get around my office. Not anymore! The length of these headphones is perfect! I never have to remove them, which is great considering that the sound produced through them is so amazing! These are by far the best pair I have ever owned. I may have converted my girlfriend off of wanting a pair of Beats by letting her use these. They look awesome and sound even better!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I've owned dozens of headphones over the years. Expensive, mid-range, and cheap.  Varying degrees of quality and sometimes not what you'd expect for the price. That said, just received these and I'm transfixed. Picked a quality source material, set the Spotify EQ response to 'flat', and slipped them on my head.  Oh my...  Flipping from Steven Wilson, Myrath, Haven, to Frost* - each artist presenting different challenges to the headphone's drivers, and these phones just shine. The quality is so good, I no longer feel inclined to jack with the EQ anymore. Terrific job, Sony.  Really Brilliant.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I know headphones are very subjective, but I like Sony sound, comfort and price-point.  Good all around for editing, listing to music or field recording.  Only thing I wish is that Sony gave you choice of changing cords -
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Zero issues, crisp frequency response, comfortable, solid construction
review_body: My favorite thing about these headphones is that you can wear them for a long time without them becoming uncomfortable in any way. Sometimes I forget I'm wearing them! The frequency response is very clear, without any noticeable deficiencies, and the design of the cord makes it potentially very long, offering tons of freedom. The construction is very solid; I've had these for over a year and they're just like new. For someone in search of the best bang for their buck in terms of sub-hundred-dollar studio headphones, I highly recommend these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Easily the best quality headphones I've had.
review_body: I love the cord's feel and the fact it extends and keeps from tying itself.Perfectly crisp sound quality. The headphones felt a little tight at first, but I got used to it very quickly.Edit: It has been years since I purchased this. The ear cushions have all worn off the plastic, but the sound quality is as high as ever. This headset has lasted twice as long as all my other products -- most of which had succumbed to wire issues. This was likely one of the best purchases I've ever made. The best part? I can buy ear cushion replacements separately.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Great buy for the money. Solid construction, and nice presentation with the packaging. I am not wowed by the bass, but the sound 'feels' clinically accurate, which is exactly what i was looking for.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: I Can't Imagine Needing Anything Better (Or More Expensive)!
review_body: Overall, these are the highest quality headphones that I have ever owned.The sound quality is fantastic, with deep lows and natural highs and mids. What I look for in a headphone is accuracy, and these supply it in force. Music just sounds like it's supposed to sound.They're pretty comfortable, but they aren't the best breathing headphone cups I've ever had. If the pads wear out, replacements (SONY 211566803 Sony Replacement Pad for Sony MDR-7506 and MDR-V6 Headphones - Each) are available from Amazon and I even hear that they're interchangeable with other types of headphones. A little Googling should provide you with a few more options if the ear-cups' style bothers you more than they do me. While we're on the topic, another thing that I really like about these cans is that anything you break on them can be replaced. Because they've been out for so long, each and every individual part on these phones is available for order. That buys you a little bit of peace of mind; in case they don't live up to their near legendary reputation for reliability.If I HAD to point out something that I didn't like, the only minor gripe that I have is, while they are foldable and come with a carrying pouch, making them somewhat portable, the cord is too long for a lot of uses. I know they're professional headphones and that the extra cord length may be needed for mixing boards and the like, but it prevents me from using them in situations where having that much cord to trip over isn't acceptable. In a perfect world they would have a breakaway cable so you could use different lengths/styles of cord for different applications.I can't imagine needing more from a set of headphones than these are able to provide. The level of detail and sonic accuracy that these provide is astounding to me, and even though I have bought more headphones since I bought these, I tend to use them as a reference point and plan on keeping them for quite some time.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Stepping up from the phones that came with your iPod or other audio device? Want accurate reproduction across the range? Want to spend under $100 for some headphones that can hang with the more expensive stuff?Headphones are not normally something I get excited about but these are great. Initially I was a little turned off by what I perceived as excessive bass but after listening to a verity of music I came to realize it wasn't the headphones at all, I had grown so accustomed to the crappy little in the ear types that I was hearing a depth to the music that I was not getting before. I can hear nuance, not just down low but across the frequency range, that was inaudible with my other headphones.One small thing that bothered me about the set I received was I soon noticed a rattle that turned out to be a bit of solder inside the right housing. About two minutes work to remove it and no more rattle. Had it not been for that I would have rated them five stars. Still, if you are looking to upgrade your phones and want excellent audio quality for under $100 the Sony MDR-7506 are going to be hard to beat.(Paid $79.95 in November 2010.)
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Great buy with one small Asterix
review_body: I greatly enjoyed the sound quality on these headphones especially at the very low price point compared to other headphones.  Although the headphones are still altogether there is something about them to does not feel sturdy. I have also noticed that the spiral cord is relaxing at incredible rate despite being flat on my desk. What this means is that it is stretching out and getting much longer.  I would not recommend these much for travel because the cord is so long. This is great if you were in a recording studio or if you're working at your computer, but traveling it tends to get in the way.sound quality? Stunning.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Best Headphone at this price point
review_body: These are the best headphones I've ever owned at this price point.  The sound they produce rivals that of Bose branded headphones that cost 3-4x as much.  I love the bass response, and the mids/highs are pristine and clearly audible.  I can hear segregation of vocals and sounds that I've never heard before in any other headphone.Buy these and pair them with a decent headphone tube amplifier and it will literally blow your mind!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Android phone and tablet and more recently with my Sony 4K 930D TV
review_body: I don't give a 5* very often. I have had these headphones for about a year and a half. I have used these headphones for up to 3 hours a day on an average. After 17 months of such regular use (and I have used them with my laptop, Android phone and tablet and more recently with my Sony 4K 930D TV) I am still amazed at the details these headphones can produce. The quality was more apparent to me after having bought and used Bose QC 25 recently. I know I am comparing these headphones with Bose's which are priced 2.5 times these. They still blow Bose out of the water. For the price and the sound quality that you get your search for the most satisfying headphones should end right here. Look no further. (BTW do remember these are studio monitors unlike Bose QC, if and when you buy them. Will save you some disappointment when you first listen to a flat response. If you are not into pure untainted sound you should rather stick to Beats instead)
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Great studio phones for a very good price.
review_body: I love these studio headphones. I use them with a Roland TD-30 for drumming at church. Previous headphone experience left me wanting more. I had some Sennheiser's that would crack at low bass drum frequency. These Sony's handle it with ease. They are also a good bargain, under $100. I have a set of Grado's that were over $200, which are awesome for critical listening, but these are work-horse and tested headphones. I trust them.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: When it came to these I was skeptical at first, like I am sure most of you out there are. I did ALOT of research and heard ALOT of great things. Such as someone stating they haven't used studio monitors in over 2 YEARS, and another individual doing a youtube video review on this product, stating it had an extremely neutral sound, yet had pristine crystal clear pickups of both the mids and highs. That settled it for me, I bought them. I can say without a doubt in my mind, they were correct. Very VERY neutral sound. I HAD to try it on a video game. EVERYTHING WAS ON THE SAME LEVEL OF SOUND! Jets, footsteps, gunfire etc... If your wanting to do music and need a cheap solution in order to make your song perfectly, this is it right here. Best part, is it folds into itself, and has it's own little bag/case. Very portable. Only cons I have, for reasons of not giving it 5 stars, is the plastic build. If your not DJ-ing and throwing things around, then it's no problem at all. Give it a buy, you won't be disappointed.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: An order of magnitude better than the headphones I was using before.  Astonishing clarity.  You can hear higher, hear deeper, hear instrument locations better, hear the timbre of the instruments more clearly.  You can hear musicians making little mistakes and adjustments on the same studio songs you've been listening to for decades.  Handles the signal so well, so efficiently, that I'm turning the volume down.  Before I couldn't get it high enough.  Spectacular.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: ... a musician I can attest that these headphones provide amazing clarity and sound range
review_body: As a musician I can attest that these headphones provide amazing clarity and sound range.  All the sounds from the lowest bass to the highest trebles are very well represented.  I will say that if you like absurd amounts of bass you may consider a different pair of headphones, but if you like the all around music experience these are the way to go.The sound quality is so good that sometimes when I’m listening to a song I’ve never heard before, I’ll hear a snare or something and turn around thinking someone is behind me because it sounds so real.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Super comfortable, great sound. I wear headphones all day at work (I am a professional sheet music editor) and these replaced a pair of Les Paul sound-muffling headphones I'd used for the past two years. I wear glasses and those had such a vice-tight grip that I'd have divots in my skin from where the arms of my glasses pressed against my head. These are a huge improvement. We also use these in our recording studio.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I'm in need of another pair of headphones, and it seems that nothing has changed since I last bought trusted Sony MDR7506 in 2011. After several years of heavy use I had to strip the old earpads and install velour ones (EDT250V), which are far more comfortable, especially on when you wear them for 6+ hours straight. They are still working, but I need one more pair and there is still no other choice...NOV2016 Update: They are still working just fine, despite their careless usage. They've been dropped from table height many times, but are in perfect condition. Had to buy another ones for second workstation, because there were no other choice.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: These are great sounding cans for a solid price
review_body: These are great sounding cans for a solid price! The only thing I'd wish was different was the length of the cable/a straight cable option, but I believe these specific headphones have been on the market since the 70s/80s, so they're probably gonna stay the same. I would recommend changing the ear pads to the Beyerdynamic EDT250V velour pads, simply because they don't cause your ears to sweat as much.Other than that, perfect construction, quality, and sound!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I've tried so many pairs of cans, and these are the best I've found. I have tried beats and monster and denon up to five hundred dollars, and was left unimpressed. I use a headphone amp or home receiver, and these give the cleanest, clearest, truest sound without distorting or sounding wimpy. Only problem is they are tight on my small to medium head, so they run hot. I think I just need to break them in more.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Another pair of rental headphones, what else is new?
review_body: I ordered these on 1/18/2016, it's 4/26/2017 as of the time of this review and the right earphone is dead. I took meticulous care of these headphones. It's a shame because they sounded great and were comfortable to wear for extended periods. The search goes on for a pair of headphones that wont break on me.Next day edit: It was one of those little cables that comes out of the earphones. Wasn't reinforced well enough but a local shop was able to fix em for 20 bucks. Sigh. I'll bump it up to 3 stars. 1 year warranty and fragile cables isn't goodnuff for 80 bucks. If they were sturdier I wouldn't hesitate to rate them 5 stars.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I bought another set because these headphones are expendable!!! A MUST HAVE for hearing exact sound the way you need to when recording etc. I love these and they are very well made, and the only thing you might have to do is about 4-5 years replace the covers for the headphones as I did my first pair but they are pract. brand new with they exception of a little tension on the wire near the headphones that has the speaker sound go in and out when moved the wrong way, but thats def not a deal breaker for a pair of headphones I use daily, and for years. Must have!!!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I come from using Microsoft 3000 USB headphones to these. At first, I was disappointed. The bass wasn't nearly as pronounced as I was used to. After time, I realized that the Microsoft 3000 has a ridiculous bass booster that muddies everything up. These headphones are much more neutral in the sense that they reproduce what was originally intended. I currently use the onboard audio from the custom PC and will be getting a sound card shortly. FLAC sounds absolutely amazing and really makes these things shine. 320 MP3 is good, but not great. These headphones will reveal what kind of material you are listening to. Overall, I love these things and will recommend them to people not wanting to spend an arm and a leg just to get better sound.Oh and I have a fantastic home theater that is amazing so I know big sound, but just wanted something more critical for listening when I don't want to disturb the neighborhood.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Many, many years ago I used to use Koss Pro studio headphones when I was a wee lad in a rock band.......many years ago.Those studio phones were great, but they weighed just slightly less than a '85 Yugo.Anyway, I bought a much less expensive pair of phones first, and was introduced to the "you get what you pay for" syndrome.So I bought these.They are comfortable (I prefer "over the ear" phones).The sound quality is great.The build quality is also great, long with a long coiled cord.Good value.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I’d never risk anything cheaper or waste money on anything more expensive. These are the sweet spot, according to me as well as my colleagues at work (professional videographers). And, of course, NO ONE beats Sony in headphones for sound quality. No one.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I hesitated before spending $100+ on headphones but these are well worth it. I'm not enough of an audio snob to tell you these are the greatest headphones on the planet but I can tell you they sound much, much better than $20 headphones.They're a lot more adjustable than cheap headphones too so they're more comfortable to wear for long periods. They have a long, coiled cord so they're easier to move around in while plugged into a computer in your cube. The earpieces are also more comfortable and seal better than the cheaper varieties.They block outside sounds quite well also, which can be good or bad depending on what you're doing while wearing these.Overall I'd say these are well worth the price if you're looking for something nicer.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Great quality headphones for the price
review_body: Great quality headphones for the price! They are comfortable to me for hours on end; I have yet to reach a point of being uncomfortable with these on. The sound is, again, really nice for what you're paying. I know for me, as a student, I cannot afford to shell out hundred of thousands of dollars on headphones. With these, I've had them for 10 months with perfect performance and the price can't be beat! I can really pick out the complexities in my music that I couldn't hear before with lesser headphones.I do wish that the cable was detachable, as it is incredibly, ridiculously long and makes these difficult to use for more casual listening.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I'm happy with this. It is not something I use on a daily basis. I got this because a friend in the broadcast business had this running off his computer as he edited some sermons. I asked him about it and looked it up. Seemed like a good thing to own. The price is more than I thought I'd spend for headphones but I liked how others liked it. Of course, there a more expensive and higher caliber headsets. For my use this is ideal.I was delighted to see the classy box it came in. Gave it an expensive look.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Very lifelike sound and comfortable to wear
review_body: Very lifelike sound and comfortable to wear.  I can tell the difference between all the digital processing settings on my receiver.  Highs, lows and midrange all sound natural to me.  Bass sounds are there but not boomy or artificial - very natural.  I was never a fan of earphones, even the electrostatic ones, but I really like this one.  One review stated they are not for music, but I totally disagree.  Can't decide which I prefer - my 11 channel speaker setup or the Sony MDR7506.  Both sound almost identical to me.  Would purchase again.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Excellent set of semi professional headphones. Comfortable for long use with excellent frequency range. Well balanced deep bass (not over exaggerated as is sometimes experienced on consumer headphones) and clean upper frequencies with a colorless mid range. Excellent for studio monitoring and general listening. Reasonable sound insulation with little leakage, so that other people will not share your music etc.!!Extensive replacement parts available if they wear out. Thoroughly recommended.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: I love the Sony family of MDR headphones
review_body: I love the Sony family of MDR headphones, and the 7506 is certainly one of my favorites. The old V6's are still top-tier, in terms of the balance between comfort, price, and sound, but the 7506's are like the luxury upgrade. Not quite as comfortable, definitely more expensive, and they *do* sound better, to my ear.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphones
review_body: I would first like to thank the other reviewers of this product, without everyones input, I would have had doubts on this purchase.  Now on to my take on these headphones:1) They are quite comfortable and easy to adjust to one's cranial needs (which for me is a big deal, considering my head is on the larger side).2) The cushions offer noise cancellation to the max and have not made my ears feel sweaty (and I have read that they need replacing after one year of use. This for me seems reasonable because of cleanliness).3) They easily fold up and down for safe keeping in the nice sony case.4) The sound quality (which is in my opinion is most important) is very luxurious! I am continually listening through my favorite songs and discovering the hidden sounds that cheap headphones will never yield.  These are also great for recording and mixing.  Breaking these in is the key to get the full depth and clarity that all have described about these headphones.I will definitely be putting these to good use.  I highly recommend sony's mdr7506's to any individual obsessed with tone and audio.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I run the sound board and record the CDs for my church as well as record spoken word CDs for myself and a group of storytellers. I have several set of headphones all purchased in a less expensive price range....I LOVE this one....I am choosy over who I let handle them however I do feel they are durable in that I am not the gentlest animal in the woods.  You can't go wrong with these...The price was also the cheapest I was able to find...These are truly what I have seen used in a lot of studios.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Well I've had these headphones on for about 20 mins and I'm in heaven. Not a professional, audiophile, or even music junkie. I couldn't stand earbuds any more, they hurt my ears and sounded terrible. These may be larger and have a goofy coiled cable that I'm sure is meant for sound professionals. But these are the most comfortable and best sounding headphones I've ever used. I feel like I'm in a recording booth!! I can't wait to bring these to school and use them in the library for studying. Also they fit great in my backpack folded up, and sony even included a cool faux leather carrying bag! Best 85 bucks I've ever spent!!!!!!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: but these sound amazing, you just need to adjust your equalization and ...
review_body: Alright, based on the price this is definitely 5 Stars. The low end bass reproduction is so hard to find in headphones at this price, but these sound amazing, you just need to adjust your equalization and turn it up load to hear it (Chris Brown's "Look me now" is a great example of low bass you can't hear on your common headphones) If it was $200 I would still give it 4 stars, I just wish I could turn them up a bit loader. Nice build and very comfortable.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I'm not quite an audiophile - so I'm not going to comment on on technical details.  The earphones sound great.  My only complaint is that the over the ear pads are a tight enough oval that my ear does not quite fit snugly into the earphones (width dimension; plenty of vertical room).  My ear fit into the enclosure much more easily on my previous pair of sennheisers (which I had used for ten years; these sony's were replacements).  And it's not like my ears are big - I once won a "smallest ears" in the room contest on a cruise.  The sound (and everything else) is good enough that I'm keeping them.  Just pointing out a detail a buyer might want to consider.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I have had these for many many years. They are excellent in all areas except one. The pads wear out over the years but I'm not complaining. They sound great and feel good on head. Highly recommended!!!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: These are awesome head phones and the sound is clear and even
review_body: These are awesome head phones and the sound is clear and even.  I had Bose headphones prior and these way outperform Bose.  Love the long extra length cord.  Fit very nicely and very comfortably!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: We've owned these headphones for three years. The sound has been outstanding, and my wife has loved using them.They have been used only occasionally and kept in the bag that came with them.However, if you will observe the attached picture, you will note that they have worn out.  We are very disappointed.We are going to order another set of some kind that has a better lifespan, given the fact that these were veryexpensive by comparison to others.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Had to get them for hubby
review_body: Hubby got me these a year and half ago and when he needed a new set of headphones, we got these because they are so "wonderful".  He kept borrowing mine, so decided he needed a set of his own, doubly "wonderful", lol.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Of all the head phones i have bought  this one is the best.  not too tight on the head fits smug comfortable even for hours.  Sound quality is very clear  perfect for office work and sound editing.  outside noise not a problem when focused on your work.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: great if you work professionally with sound (like radio
review_body: great if you work professionally with sound (like radio, sound editing, sound mixing, music recording etc), because they're extremely durable and very accurate.however, if you are "just" a consumer and want headphones just to listen to music, watch film (ie. for fun), then these aren't for you, you'll miss the thicker, fuller sound you'd expect from headphones like these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I've previously owned MDR7505's which were great. I wanted a set of cans that I could use on my bus commute. I've been using Bose in-ear phones which sound nice, but wanted more isolation and clarity. So I bought these. Well, they sound great! I listen to various rock, country, jazz, neo-soul for the most part. The frequency response is awesome, and the 7506's are easily driven by my iPad and iPod. I've tried quite a few headphones, and for the price, these are outstanding. Sure, my Sennheiser HD-650's are better, but not by leaps and bounds. I would buy these again in a second. Buy these and save yourself some money instead of overpaying for a product that is not nearly as good. Don't get fooled by the hype (i.e. Beats). Your ears will thank you.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Crisp, roomy sound that pumps out highest highs and lowest lows with consistent clarity. There was some static electric shock activity after I wore them while walking in the rain, but they recovered completely after about a week. The cord is a little heavy just because there's so much of it all coiled up, but the stretch factor is worth the weight. I'm prone to getting headaches from wearing headbands, glasses, etc., but I find that the ear pads on these don't bother me at all. Great product for the cost, especially if you're into music with lots of layering and intricacy.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Not the cutest but you seriously can't beat the sound!!
review_body: I had to return them cause my boyfriend already had them! They were to be a Christmas gift. BUT the reason he already had them is cause they are the BEST of BEST headphones. He has a band and they do lots of music producing and all that and he says they are ugly but the best headphones one can buy in terms of sound. Like I said, they aren't the coolest looking headset but you cannot beat the sound and this is coming from a guy who's been in the music industry for over a decade.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I bought these to replace my old Sony MDR7506 Headphones because there were old and kinda falling apart. ( I had them for years!). These are exactly what I wanted and perfect for my home music studio!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: There is a reason Sony still makes these....They Rule!
review_body: I have loved Sony headphones forever, always reliable and sound perfect. I am in broadcasting and had a pair of these for 15 years. And they were used daily, on and off my head for hours each day. When they had given up the ghost I tried replacing them with a different model that Sony has since discontinued but I had to buy two pairs in the same time frame as these. Sony still making these is a tribute to how good they are. I can't wait to see how long these last. I didn't hesitate going back to the tried and tested standard. Used by a normal person these could last a lifetime if cared for.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Bought these headphones specifically for listening to classical music while studying/completing school work. The sound quality is unbelievable, far better than a $50 headphone. I can't compare it to a more expensive one as I do not have experience with that. The construction is solid. The adjustments on the left and right side for size have etchings and numbers so you can match them evenly on both sides. The coiled cord is great, takes up little space when the full length is not needed but easily extends to 9 meters when you do need it. Great buy.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: This is the best deal on the planet for headphones
review_body: This is the best deal on the planet for headphones. I own 3 sets of high end Bose, a pair of HiFi man audiophile headphones.  Im in the film business and work with music all the time. This is the original headphone Sony made for sound studios and musicians. If you go to most major studios, you will see these phones still being used. They sound great, with a very clean and allow you to hear everything. They dont have the fake heavy bass thing going like the headphones kids buy. They will blow you away with the clean clear sound, not the pumped up fake bass thing.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Just received these today, love them already. Light, comfortable, well designed, and all though I can't claim to be an audiophile, the sound seems great to me. They come with a carrying pouch, and fold up easily for transport. Very happy with the purchase.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: These are quality headphones with amazing sound.  For the sub-100 dollar price tag, I think they're a great value. These aren't bass heavy like some other headphones, but they are so, so, good in the mid to high tones. The sound is crisp, clean, and clear. Listening with these, after using a pair of V-Moda Crossfade LPs, is a little bit like going from dvd to blu-ray. The sound is so much more detailed, I notice sounds in tracks where I couldn't hear (or didn't notice) them, before. If I somehow lost these tomorrow, I would reorder them again without a second thought.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Amazing headphones.I was using (decent) earbuds for gaming forever and when The WireCutter recommended these combined with the lower price, I went for it. Such an incredible difference!I don't know nothing about levels or peaks or frequency response, just that they are sound great to me.  They're bulky, but apparently are very sturdy so should be OK if you use some care. Don't think they'd be great travel due to size; does come with a bag so there you go.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Headphones are actually really good for the price
review_body: Headphones are actually really good for the price, but they broke after a month or so and it was absolutely impossible to get ahold of Sony or anyone to talk to about it. Even the warranty number on the box wasn't working...
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Excellent set of headphones.  I did quite a bit of internet research and found these to be highly regarded.  They are comfortable and the sound is outstanding.  The telephone-style cord expands nicely.  The build quality is solid and the headphones are an excellent value.  I'm very happy with the purchase.Update 1/1/2015: After using these headphones for a while, I find that I am hearing nuances in the music that I didn't notice before, even with a respectable table-top sound system.  I really like the over-hear experience because it makes for a more immersive experience.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I've had MDR-V6's for over 14 years for DJ'ing purposes and set out on a misson to find a suitable replacement as I was starting to look like a hobo when playing gigs. All the pleather had almost completly worn off the headband, the earpads had been replaced 3 times, the cable going to each earpad was a lil crimped and every night I was left with black flecks all over my shirts/face .. however still working like a dream (yes they sound SOOO much better after a few hundred hours burn-in).So after buying (and subsequently selling) oodles of pairs of "modern" earphones I literally could not find anything sub $200 that could touch them for both studio and live work - they literally tick EVERY box, including portability and when I saw them on Amazon for $77 I just bit the bullet (again)... and my old friends return..... SOME of the headphones I tested against:HD25 - these are a million times more comfortable for long hours, soundwise however on-par IMHO.Audio Technica ATH-50's - Felt like comparing a Galaxy -S to an Iphone 4, Mid / top end was horrible.Marshall Majors - In a NON-A/B test the Marshalls actually sounded Decent, and I bought a pair on a whim - A/B tested at home and sold them a week laterMarshsall Studio's - Sounded Nice until I did a comparison.Pioneer HDJ500's - Probably the biggest TURD in the bunch, these felt like I had actual pieces of vinyl stuck to my ears and were wayyyy too bigTMA-1's - decent except for the size was huge on my tiny head and have quite an exaggerated bass end.In fact the only headphones that really shined in comparison were the Superlux 661's for $30, which almost sound identical and I probably would have bought a pair except they didn't fit my head properly and the pads felt yukkie !!Some people will complain about the cables being non-replacable, well in this department sony got it right, becuase the cable will never NEED to be replaced its seriously tough and been through the wars, however I'm going to modify mine with a shorter straight cable for DJ use !I would go so far as to say the only headphone that I would consider using if these ever get stolen/eaten/run over by a car would be the MDR-1 which have almost exactly the same sound characteristics and are a better looking headphone - but for $230 more !!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: This was an upgrade to the inexpensive headphones I was using at the gym, which were uncomfortable and didn't reduce background noise. These are very comfortable, reduce background noise and are great for listening to audio books while working out. The cord is quite long, which might be annoying for some people, but for me it works nicely since I can put my tablet on the base of the machine while using the treadmill
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: These sound great!  I got them for work and for listening to online classes.  They have great sound, especial for the price.  They seem to be well made with quality components and materials.  I know someone who has had a pair for several years and they look almost as good as my brand new ones!  They are comfortable to wear and even though they dont have noise canceling they block out a lot of sound.  People have to tap me on the shoulder to get my attention at work.  I highly recommend these to anyone that is looking good sound quality at a good price.  You dont need the latest $300+ hype brand to have a good listening experience.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: Have no clue about headphones, relied on reviews, and am very pleased I went with this one. I do find the foldable feature a bit of a hassle. And be careful as the folding design can pinch your hand, and it took a painful while to get it to release.

review_title: Lasted almost two years... then started to fail
review_body: These headphone have been great up until a couple weeks ago. Sound from the right side if less than half of what the left side is producing. I honestly thought it was my hearing or other equipment but other headphones work fine and if I flip the headphone around, I can hear fine. No signs of damage to the headphones. I won't be buying these again.

I've used it for field audio monitoring in two movies and one documentary I shot, I've used it for sound editing and mostly for listening to my music. It is a great product. The sound quality is simply outstanding. I would only recommend to buy replacement ear pads because the factory one shrink after a while. I just bought these Beyerdynamic EDT250V Headphone Ear Pads Black as replacement. Otherwise, 5 solid stars.

review_body: On the price-performance curve, you can't do much better than these. A good flat response with fidelity across the spectrum. For those of you used to $5-$50 headsets and earbuds, they will introduce you to a new dimension of your music. For those who are familiar with high-end headsets, they are inexpensive and durable enough to keep a pair everywhere you need one.The ear pads are comfortable, although they are a bit warm (as with all over-the-ear headsets). The cord is more than long enough, and coiled to stay out of the way.

review_body: I bought these for use with my electric drumset. [Roland TD-6 module]. Overall, I really like the sound. They isolate the music/drums enough that I don't hear the rubber pads, and they sound great for regular music too! My only complaint is that the higher frequencies seem a bit loud - I notice it especially with the electric drumkit and don't know if it is the headphones or because the TD-6 is an older module Glad to finally have quality headphones that were fairly affordable.

review_body: These are professional quality headphones. Our college son is into music making and these are excellent to achieve high quality music making, mixing, recording, listening... Very high quality!
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I'll start this by saying that there are definitely better sounding headphones out there (even in the same price range) but in terms of durability and reliability theses headphones are everything I need. I keep these headphone in my kit for when I do on location audio capture and they have yet to fail me. After listening through them for a while i've noticed that they boost the high and low frequencies a touch compared to the mid range (still a far cry from any beats product though). I would recommend that you replace the ear pads because when they start to deteriorate that will leave little shreds of the black material everywhere. The Beyerdynamic EDT250V ear pads are what I used and they work great.

review_body: Just buy em. Sounds amazing. Comfort is amazing. They fold up relatively small fot travel. Cone w a carry bag. Have a extra heavy duty 1/8th” aux cord thats wont break with some bending as even nice Sennenhysers I’ve had do. Plus a gteat price. You won’t be dissapointed.

(Hmmmm, LOL;)  )  But, the vinyl or black materials on the ear covers is already pealing off in small pieces and sticking to his head. For the price, would like a materials that doesn't fall apart. review_body: I wanted to get a better set of headphones for my ipod. I Started with Bose and though they sounded nice the reviews said they break easily. I tried a pair at Target. Then went and checked out the Senheiser. I didn't want an extra long jack, having to use the adaptor to take the jack from standard to ipod size. So I checked out the Sony 7506 set. I checked the majority of the reviews were all favorable. So I placed the order. I received them in about three days. Good Job Amazon. As far as the headphones go. At first they seemed a little warm, but that soon passed. I was really inpressed with the sound quality. The highs and the base are clear and crisp. You can distinguish the different instruments playing. I listen to a lot of New Age and World Music. These phones are made well and are comfortable to wear. They do cancel out a lot of outside noine. I'm looking forward to many years of enjoyment.I'm very happy with my purchase.

review_body: As others state, the audio quality is legendary. The cord is long, sturdy, and comes with a 1/4-inch adapter. They are a bit heavier than most over-ear headphones I have used, which makes them a bit uncomfortable for long periods of use (i.e. gaming all day). All in all, a solid product.

review_title: Great sound and I love the adapter for the jack
review_body: Great sound and I love the adapter for the jack.The only downside is the "self folding" action makes it hard to get these onto my head. It's not as simple as just pulling the speakers down. The Sony offers bass and mid range that in my opinion sounds crisper and delivers a true replication of the studio mixes. The headphones were delivered promptly and have met my every expectation.

review_title: A great addition to my headphone collection
review_body: A great addition to my headphone collection.  Fairly good isolation, great fit and comfort.  I have several headphones and this is one of the few that fits completely over my big ears without making me uncomfortable or overly warm my ears.  Of course you buy headphones for the sound and that is where these shine.  Great bass, tight not over-driven, incredible highs ( I listen to Epica which has an amazing soprano voice mixed with thundering metal music), and the mids  are never muddled or left out.  Overall they are a perfect fit for use at home, but at the office they are just a bit too much.  I would say the best Ive listened to in the sub $150 range and worth every penny.  Solid construction, Quality Construction, and folds up nicely for storage.

review_title: Amazed at the quality for the price
review_body: I don't often write reviews, however I had to for these. I spent hours and hours doing research on a good, affordable pair of over the ear headphones. I read reviews on various sites as well as reviews on here, and finally decided to go with this. Honestly, I couldn't be happier.They are comfortable even for long periods of use (I had them on for a 5 hour flight, never got sore ears). They aren't noise canceling per say, however they certainly do block out some background noise. The sound is good, very "crisp", not too "bass-ey", which I like. However don't get me wrong, there is bass. If you are looking for a great solid pair of over the ear headphones, your search can end here, my friend!

review_body: These are my first set of professional headphones and I'm not disappointed at all. I had someone who let me try their Beats headphones and they are s***. Nothing special. These headphones on the other hand are beautiful! They truly are flat response but don't let the word "flat" fool you. That just means that they pay attention to all the sounds equally with no special attention to bass or treble,  etc. The bass on these are deep and sensual. The sound is crisp and clear and I have enjoyed listening to my music on them BC I've heard details in songs I didn't hear before. These are truly amazing for the price. I suggest you buy these if you're on a budget and looking for professional headphones.

review_body: After giving my Audio Technicas to a relative, I needed a good pair of closed cans that had the same bang for my buck, and these do not disappoint. review_body: These headphones are legendary.  I got these because they were recommended by my teacher for sound engineering.  There are others a lot more expensive, i did not get to compare them, but I really don't need to, this works great.  You can hear everything, this is great for mixing or listening for errors in your music or just listening to music in general.  You will hear a lot of detail on these that you won't hear with other headphones or regular speakers.  It also slightly cancels the surrounding noise even though they are not noise canceling headphones.  They are not extremely bass heavy so if you boost the bass too much it will distort (but that's not what they're designed for anyways).  This is an all around great product, it does what it's designed to do.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: I don't get all the reviews that complain about how bright the mid range and high end frequencies are on these cans.  They're studio monitors.  They're supposed to be flat-but-responsive.  If it's hard to listen to then add some EQ to your signal chain.They respond across the entire spectrum.  From low end to high.  You can't ask for much more than that.The only valid complaint that I see about these cans is the earpads are flimsy and come apart easily.  I hope sony fixes that in their manufacturing process at some point.Mine work flawlessly.  5 stars until I start to have issues with the earpads.  Then I may come back and edit this review.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: Great Phones and Definitely Different Than the MDR-V6's
review_body: I've had some Sony MDR-V6's for a lot of years now, and after reading tons of opinions on how they compare to their sibling, these MDR-7506's, I figured I would pick a pair up and do my own comparison.  I know this horse has been beaten to death, but it only took a short amount of listening to realize the differences.  But, before I get into it too far I just want to say that both models are excellent headphones; and it's amazing that either set can be had for less than $100.And a WARNING to all buyers.  Because these phones have been around forever, and because they are so popular (I think Sony sells more than 35,000 pairs of these a month) there are lots of fakes out there.  You can research this on the web, but the safest way to insure you are getting the real deal is to make sure that when you purchase here on Amazon you only buy when it says "Ships from and sold by Amazon.com".  It is the easiest way to be sure you're getting the genuine article.Everybody hears differently, and everyone "listens" differently.  We don't all enjoy the same types of music, and similarly, every set of headphones is not necessarily suited for every genre of music.  We all own different source components, and most of us have a limit as to what we are willing to spend on our gear.  I believe every headphone review should include a brief summary of the reviewer's musical tastes, sources, and gear and should always including references to other sets of cans they own, have auditioned, liked, or disliked.  With so many variables affecting peoples like or dislike of any pair of phones it is my goal to help those with similar musical tastes and similar gear to determine whether or not these headphones will be a good investment for them personally.To that end; I listen to music in practically every genre.  I tend to go through different phases, but I enjoy Mozart as much as Metallica, 80's one hit wonders and New Orleans Jazz, Lady Antebellum or Lady Gaga, Eminem to Zedd.  Music has so much to offer in all genres that one could spend a lifetime discovering new things they like.  I use my computer to play all the usual manner of digital files, and an Onkyo C-7030 CD player to handle disk duty.  Both feed into my Nuforce Icon DAC/Headphone Amp.  The digital files via USB and the CDs via analog RCA (the Onkyo has excellent onboard D/A conversion).  I have also been playing around with a Little Dot MK2 ii Vacuum Tube Amp (which I am really starting to love).  It should also be noted that I use no equalizer to modify the sound of my music (because I don't have one available in my setup).  My headphones include Sony MDR-V6s and these MDR-7506s, V-Moda Crossfade LPs and M-100s, Audio Technica ATH-M50s, Beyerdynamic DT-880 250ohm Premiums, Sennheiser HD 598s and HD 600s (my personal favorite) as well as my 4th pair of Koss Porta-Pros (easy to exchange when you live in Milwaukee) .  I've tried Grado SR 80s and SR 225s (just too darn uncomfortable), some Beyerdynamic DT990 Pro 250ohms (I prefered the DT 880s), and my son even owns a pair of first generation Beats Solo phones (Yuk).  The other day I threw away some Denon's (no clue what model, but circa 1990) and a set of Sony MDR-V600s that were both totally worn out.  I also own lots of buds as well (my Klipsh X10s being my favorite).Like I said at the beginning, these headphones sound great.  They are by far my favorite set of closed phones.  The crossfades are fun (they'll make your teeth chatter), but the sound is very unnatural.  The ATH-M50s sound excellent as well, but I prefer the Sony's more natural midrange.  I like them with most genre's of music, but I prefer them with classical, jazz, adult contemporary, jazz rock, and other similar genres of music.  The 7506's (and V6's) also give the widest soundstage of all my closed cans.  When comparing the sound to the V6's I would say this.  Both models have some of the most natural sounding mids I have heard in a headphone.  The V6s have more bass and noticeably higher highs, where the 7506's are flatter through the audible spectrum.  That's pretty much it in a nutshell.  It isn't hard to hear the difference, and you can see it as well by going to Headphone dot com's "build a graph" page and comparing the two.  The build a graph is an excellent page and when I look at the graphs for the various phones I own it shows exactly what I'm hearing myself.  I have heard many reasons for the differences between the two sets of Sonys from wiring to cup shape, and I've read all the references to the parts list that says they have all the same pieces, but all I'll say again is that there is a difference.  If you like a flatter sound with less of a "smile curve" then these 7506's are what you're looking for.  If you like a bit more bass and treble I'd recommend the V6's (though the highs can cause fatigue after a while).  If you are looking for cans to monitor or edit video then the 7506's are the ticket.  It's amazing how accurately they can playback the sound I record with my video camera, and it's no surprise that you see these on the heads of people in the movie business when you watch behind the scenes extras on DVD's and Blu-Rays.  I have taken the V6's to work and I use them with my little Nuforce uDAC-2 as the two pair together very well, and the 7506's are my go-to phones at home when open cans won't do.  The phones are very efficient as well.  They play plenty loud without a lot of power, though they sound even better with a nice amp.  They are also very revealing.  While you will hear lots of details in your music, you will also hear all of the flaws.  Music with accentuated highs may also sound shrill and sibilant when using these phones.  If you want lots of booming bass you'd be best to look elsewhere.  The 7506's have nice low, accurate, detailed bass, but they aren't thumpers by any means (nor are the V6's). If you want some serious thump on a budget watch for the V-Moda Crossfade LP's to go on sale (you will sacrifice detail and clarity, however).The build quality is excellent and I'm alright with the earpads wearing out and needing replacement from time to time (I'm on at least my 5th set in 2 decades with the V6's).  All earcups need to be replaced sooner or later, and if you shop around you can find the Sony replacements for a cheap price.  If you opt for some of the velour replacements that are out there you will (or you should) notice a change in the sound (I've tried them with the v6's).  It's also important to watch the foam part of the cups that covers the driver.  If it starts to break down it will get pushed into the holes in the front of the driver itself and it will ruin it (this is what happened to my V600's).  The phones are very light, the comfort is excellent, the clamping pressure is pretty light, and the sound isolation is really good too.  I also like the coiled cord and the quick change screw plug.  I have never had an issue with my cord on my V6's in almost 20 years and I don't foresee a problem with the 7506's.  The carry bag is handy and surprisingly durable as well.  I do wish they locked in a little tighter when you opened them as they often seem to want to close back up while trying to put them on.  You also have to be careful for the right side wire as it can get pinched in the whole works and possibly become crimped.You just can't go wrong with The 7506's or the V6's at the price they sell for.  You just have to decide which response curve you prefer.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: These are by far the best headphones I've ever owned. I'm a video editor and I don't know how I was able to edit my audio before having these. They are so clear across all the frequencies giving me the ability to hear subtle background noises as well as deep bass. The noise cancelation acts like ear muffs. While I'm wearing these, I can't hear someone speaking to me 10 feet away (normal voice while music is playing low).I would highly recommend these.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_title: I absolutely love these. I'm not an audiophile
review_body: I absolutely love these. I'm not an audiophile, but they sound great and don't compress my head too much and don't give me headaches are long periods of use like some over-the-ear headphones do to me. Really recommend some Velour ear cups (like these Beyerdynamic EDT250V Headphone Ear Pads Black) as well for added comfort. They fold up to a pretty small size too so they're great for traveling. Cable is plenty long.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: These can't be beat for the price. My high-priced Shure's were stolen and there was a good price on these and the reviews are good, so I decided to try them out. They're well worth the money - the sound reproduction and fidelity is excellent for the price.
article: Sony MDR7506 Professional Large Diaphragm Headphone

review_body: My wife thinks the TV is too loud when she isn't watching it.  I bought these head phone because I don't have bluetooth on my TV and it has a long cord.  It works for both of us except she has to duck under the cord when she wants to walk in front of the TV.

review_body: I've been looking at buying these for a year now. I have a Tascam DP-32 that I wanted headphones that produced a great sound and were comfortable. While working on a project I was able to hear something in the sound mix everyone else had missed.  Really comfortable, was worried the pads would be too big but they're not.  I use these at home and the Sony MDR V6 at work.  Both are great, sound quality is excellent, when I work I need to hear it all.
